diseases.remedy: Honey in warm water (aperient), rest and moderation of food
diseases.method: Drink warm water sweetened with honey to soften stomach and loosen bowels
diseases.dose: 1–2 tbsp honey in 1 cup (200 ml) warm water; repeat until relief
diseases.timing: On empty stomach; Prophet suggested repeating as needed; general wellness 3×/month noted
diseases.source: Natural Healing with the Medicine of the Prophet — case of bowel problem and honey remedy
diseases.remedy_description: Honey in warm water is a soothing tonic; visually a golden syrup dissolving into warm liquid with sweet aroma. More images: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Honey

diseases.remedy: She-camel’s milk and urine (historical), diuretics and laxatives
diseases.method: Traditionally drink she-camel milk and small amount of urine during estrus as diuretic; modern equivalents: medically approved diuretics
diseases.dose: Narration mentions cups of milk and small urine portions; text descriptive rather than clinical (~½ cup milk plus small urine quantity cited historically)
diseases.timing: Until swelling reduces; traditionally when herd feeding on certain herbs improves efficacy
diseases.source: Natural Healing with the Medicine of the Prophet — Section IV: Treatment of Dropsy (Hadith of Arab visitors). Also appears in Tib-e-Nabvi
diseases.remedy_description: Camel milk is a white, slightly opaque liquid with a thin, watery texture and a mildly salty, tangy taste; historical remedies sometimes mention camel urine alongside milk. More images: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Camel_milk

diseases.remedy: Honey as solvent, dietary purgatives, laxatives
diseases.method: Use honey to open pores and help purgation combined with diet adjustments
diseases.dose: 1–2 tbsp honey in warm water; diet per practitioner guidance
diseases.source: Natural Healing with the Medicine of the Prophet — honey benefits and organ obstructions
diseases.remedy_description: Honey acts as a natural solvent and mild laxative when taken warm; golden and viscous with sweet taste. More images: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Honey
